title.narrative: Improving the Quality of Initial and Primary Education in Uruguay

description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to improve the teaching practices and the learning environment in early and primary education, as well as the internal efficiency in primary education, all in Full-Time Schools, and to strengthen the evaluation capacity of the education system.

participating-org.narrative: ANEP - Administracion Nacional de Educacion Publica
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: LOAN AGREEMENT - SCHEDULE 2, Section I.A.1To facilitate the carrying out of the Project, the Borrower shall make the proceeds ofthe Loan available to the Project Implementing Entity, under a subsidiary agreement between the Borrower and the ProjectImplementing Entity, under terms and conditions approved by the Bank (the “Inter-Administrative Agreement”).

PROJECT AGREEMENT - SCHEDULE, Section I.A.4 (a)Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, the Project ImplementingEntity shall enter into an agreement (the “Verification Agreement”) with an agency with experience and qualifications acceptable tothe Bank (the “Verification Entity”), for purposes of assisting the Project Implementing Entity in the implementation of Part 4 ofthe Project (including, inter alia, the verification of compliance of selected DLIs), under terms and conditions acceptable to theBank (as these are further detailed in the Operational Manual).

title.narrative: Teachers recruited or trained - Female (RMS requirement)
IRI15. First grade repetition rate in quintile 1 and 2 FTS.
IRI1. Number of additional classrooms for 3-year-olds resulting from Project interventions
IRI11. Number of FTS that receive support targeted for teachers with students at risk in the sixth grade
IRI14. Number of census-based standardized student assessments carried out at the ECD or Primary levels.
IRI8. Number of FTS that are equipped with physical and educational equipment.
IRI7. Number of additional primary level classrooms built or rehabilitated in FTS resulting from Project intervention.
IRI 16. Beneficiary Feedback. Share of FTS benefiting from Project interventions that use teacher or parent apps to carry out beneficiary satisfaction surveys
PDO4. Evaluation Capacity. Share of schools that use national student-level assessment results for decision-making
PDO2. Learning environment. Number of additional students enrolled in schools that meet required quality standards.
IRI2. ECD teachers of FTS use mobile libraries at least once a week
IRI9. Number of FTS that annually receive resources and technical assistance for preventive maintenance.
PDO3. Internal efficiency. First grade repetition rate in FTS.
Sub-PDO3. First grade repetition rate gender gap in FTS.
IRI4. ECD assessment results inform first grade teachers

target.value: Local ECD assessment is developed and approved by the Project Implementing Entity. (DLI 6)

actual.value: ECD assessment results (EIT) integrated into GURI's databased and local ECD assessment developed and approved by the ProjectImplementing Entity.

title.narrative: IRI10. Primary teachers, principals and inspectors accredit in-service training courses.

actual.value: 2,926 passed the first of two cycles

title.narrative: IRI6. ECD teachers of FTS accredit in-service training courses
IRI12. Pilot experience linking FTS with secondary schools.

actual.value: Activities began in 8 FTS in 2018 and 1 additional FTS was incorporated in 2019.

title.narrative: IRI5. FTS ECD teachers apply protocols for at-risk students

target.value: 70% of ECD teachers of all FTS carry out interventions according to the guidelines for students that do not achieve the expectedlevel of development

actual.value: ECD teaching guidelines and protocols for at-risk students included in the ECD in-service training

title.narrative: Sub-PDO1. Increase in the teaching practices score in FTS based in self-reports.
IRI 13. Creation of a monitoring system for students' academic trajectories

target.value: Results report of the pilot and its expansion

title.narrative: PDO1. Increase in the teaching practices score in FTS based on class observation.
IRI3. Increase in the share of 5-year-old students in FTS with an "expected" development level.
